id: relates an assessment or report to an agent that conducts the assessment
name: relates an assessment or report to an agent that conducts the assessment

id: activity involving the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, ability, or value of someone or something
name: activity involving the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, ability, or value of someone or something

id: date on which an assessment process was completed
name: date on which an assessment process was completed

id: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace additional content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace additional content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: estimated value of some asset as of a given point in time
name: estimated value of some asset as of a given point in time

id: Assessments.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: Assessments.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: judgement, appraisal, or view about something
name: judgement, appraisal, or view about something

id: This ontology defines abstract concepts for assessments, evaluations, and outcomes, as the basis for various analysis, such as for business performance, compliance and risk.
name: This ontology defines abstract concepts for assessments, evaluations, and outcomes, as the basis for various analysis, such as for business performance, compliance and risk.

id: relates an appraised value to the asset of interest as of the date of the assessment
name: relates an appraised value to the asset of interest as of the date of the assessment

id: party that evaluates or estimates the nature, quality, ability, or value of someone or something
name: party that evaluates or estimates the nature, quality, ability, or value of someone or something

id: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was revised to augment the definition of appraisal with an estimated value and correct a bug in the definition of hasAppraiser.
name: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was revised to augment the definition of appraisal with an estimated value and correct a bug in the definition of hasAppraiser.

id: relates something to its estimated value
name: relates something to its estimated value

id: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was revised to add the concept of a valuation method, which is then applied in the context of a value assessment.
name: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was revised to add the concept of a valuation method, which is then applied in the context of a value assessment.

id: Note that an appraiser in this context may be a licensed appraiser, such as a real estate appraiser or auction house, or a calculation agent, depending on the circumstances.
name: Note that an appraiser in this context may be a licensed appraiser, such as a real estate appraiser or auction house, or a calculation agent, depending on the circumstances.

id: written estimate of the market value of something as of some point in time, typically provided by a qualified appraiser
name: written estimate of the market value of something as of some point in time, typically provided by a qualified appraiser

id: event involving the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something
name: event involving the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something

id: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: Assessments.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: provides an approximate value of some asset as of some point in time
name: provides an approximate value of some asset as of some point in time

id: assessment event to estimate the value of something
name: assessment event to estimate the value of something

id: indicates the strategy used for the purposes of determining the fair market or present value of something
name: indicates the strategy used for the purposes of determining the fair market or present value of something

id: Asset valuation is the process of determining the fair market or present value of assets, using book values, absolute valuation models like discounted cash flow analysis, option pricing models or comparables. Such assets include investments in marketable securities such as stocks, bonds and options; tangible assets like buildings and equipment; or intangible assets such as brands, patents and trademarks.
name: Asset valuation is the process of determining the fair market or present value of assets, using book values, absolute valuation models like discounted cash flow analysis, option pricing models or comparables. Such assets include investments in marketable securities such as stocks, bonds and options; tangible assets like buildings and equipment; or intangible assets such as brands, patents and trademarks.

id: method used to determine the present or expected worth of an asset
name: method used to determine the present or expected worth of an asset

id: report that includes an opinion, judgement, appraisal, or view about something and typically the methodology and raw inputs used to arrive at that opinion
name: report that includes an opinion, judgement, appraisal, or view about something and typically the methodology and raw inputs used to arrive at that opinion
